case_circumstances: The body of a white female was found nude in the street at the corner of MLK and Cass Ave. in the city of Detroit. She had been badly beaten and died two days later in the hospital.  She wore a distinctive jacket (tan with reversible blue plaid) with the Big Apple emblem,wording "NYC #1",  the Brooklyn Bridge and a Peace symbol handpainted upon it.
case_head_hair: Long and brown with a few gray streaks
case_eye_description:

Blue-Gray in another

case_clothing_on_body: Blue jeans,a tan- reversible to blue plaid- jacket,  decorated with the "Big Apple" emblem with wording "NYC #1" and a depiction of the Brooklyn Bridge and a peace sign handpainted on it.
case_jewelry: A broken pearl necklace was found in the pocket of her jeans
